reviews.review: First things first play thru Half-Life 2 before playing Thru Half-Life 2:Episode One because this takes place right after Half-Life 2. ok this one was really short tok me about 3 hours to do with barely useing any weapons and i kinda wished it was parth of Half-Life 2 and instead being its own short game after but is the only thing i really disliked about this part oof the story and after this one make sure to play Half-Life 2:Epiosde Two cause Part One and Part Two is what should connect from Half-Life 2 - Half-Life 3 but lets face it its been so many years i really dont think Half-Life 3 is ever gonna happen. But this and its Part 2 can feel as much of a Half-Life 3 to men and its a really great story. so if you lifed everything before Half-Life 2 as well as 2 then yoll really enjoy thisd and want to compelete the story.

I played this immidiately after playing the main game and have to say that the pacing of this game has been nailed down to a crisp! Everything is adjusted to the best possible speed and carefully crafter levels that don't drag on for too long. But for some reason, just like the last game, I didn't feel the urgency at the end. It felt like an episode (which it is) and it lacked the amount of chaos that would have heightened the ending. But it was better than the main game. So a 9/10 for me.

A short but good sequel to Half Life 2. That's it. I don't need to write anything else to get you to buy this. You probably came here to finish the Half Life 2 story so I'm 90% certain you're gonna buy it anyways.

[h1] Developing HL2 Episode 1[/h1]
*Valve HQ 2009*
"Alright boys, we're ready to make half life 2 episode one, any ideas?"
"why don't we put the players in the WORST parts of HL2?"
"like the ones were you have no items, and the challenge is in how fast you can run away from the enemies?"
"Yeah, those ones. Oh and make sure we have the striders take 7 rockets on normal, AND they can shoot through walls!*"
*Gabe Newell leans over to the treasurer and whispers*
"Give those two a raise."

Little short than other episode,but still great :D 
10/10

A solid continuation of the original game, but it ultimately falls short of being something truly special like the first one. It's also a lot shorter, meaning that you probably won't have enough time to appreciate the finer aspects of the game.
It's nice to expand the HL2 story. It's very short tho. Worth it when on sale so buy during that period.

I know this is long overdue but I noticed that Episode 1,2 were on sale. Mind you the price before is still cheap I just never got around to playing these episodes because ever since the halt on the Half-Life series I completely forgot about them. So I ended up playing it and loved it. Funny thing is I didn't even buy any new games this year because lately I haven't really been intrigued or satisfied. Leave it to Half-Life 2 to bring me back memorable times of gaming. Alyx is still #1 Waifu.

Pretty short, but a pretty good sequel.
